Dear Ayah,

 

Hope you’re doing well.

 

Regarding the insurance clause, I agree that insurance should be paid for and managed by Akana Collective. It is standard and appropriate for the supplier to be responsible for all necessary insurance related to their services, staff, and subcontractors. 

 

Any additional insurance required for venue compliance in KSA, should ideally be included in their pricing, not charged separately.  Looping @Hagop Ghazarian <mailto:Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com>  to please review this clause & advise.

 

Warm regards,

Nutan

From: Ayah Yamani <Ayah.Yamani@chalhoub.com <mailto:Ayah.Yamani@chalhoub.com> >
Sent: Thursday, August 21, 2025 07:03
To: Carlos Daoud <Carlos.Daoud@chalhoub.com <mailto:Carlos.Daoud@chalhoub.com> >; Abdullah Almadhi <Abdullah.Almadhi@chalhoub.com <mailto:Abdullah.Almadhi@chalhoub.com> >
Cc: Dana Mahdi <Dana.Mahdi@chalhoub.com <mailto:Dana.Mahdi@chalhoub.com> >; Nina Samin <Nina.Samin@chalhoub.com <mailto:Nina.Samin@chalhoub.com> >; May Karaki <May.Karaki@chalhoub.com <mailto:May.Karaki@chalhoub.com> >; Nutan Correa <Nutan.Correa@chalhoub.com <mailto:Nutan.Correa@chalhoub.com> >; Lauren Sterling <Lauren.Sterling@chalhoub.com <mailto:Lauren.Sterling@chalhoub.com> >; Karen Nassar <Karen.Nassar@chalhoub.com <mailto:Karen.Nassar@chalhoub.com> >
Subject: KSA 70 Years Reception - Agreement

 

Dear Carlos,

 

I hope all is well.

 

I’m happy to reconnect with you to share the draft SOW document / agreement with Akana for the 70 Years Reception in KSA by way of tracked changes including my comments for your kind review and comments. 

Kindly attaching for your reference the draft LOI we had prepared for this project noting that the final direction was to proceed without the LOI as agreed with our Procurement team.

 

Please find below 2 overarching points from my side:

Kindly attaching for your reference the draft LOI we had prepared for this project noting that the final direction was to proceed without the LOI as agreed with our Procurement team.

 

Please find below 2 overarching points from my side:

 

*	We plan to process the payment for local production elements with Akana’s local partner in KSA (Denaj), while keeping all payments regarding technical support with Akana keeping in mind VAT and WHT. We do not have an agreement in place with Denaj and a portion of the scope of services will be invoiced by them to CGA directly. Can we incorporate that into this agreement with Akana?
*	The venue requires insurance coverage which will be provided by the agency (Akana are charging us for this since they have limited coverage in KSA). We have been advised by Admin to include a clause in our agreement with the agency and in the separate agreement with the venue that covers this in line with the following:

*                  Contractually the event managers and caterers should agree to assume any responsibility for damages arising from their negligence.

*                  Like this, in the unfortunate event of a loss, the insurer would pay and recover from the responsible entity.

 

On another note, I will leave it to @Abdullah Almadhi <mailto:Abdullah.Almadhi@chalhoub.com>  to share the contract with the venue 'Diriyah’ for consistency.

 

Looking forward to hearing back.

 

Many thanks.

 

Regards,

 

AYAH YAMANI

​​​​

DIRECTOR ‑ COUNTRY MANAGEMENT



CHALHOUB GROUP ARABIA LIMITED COMPANY LLC

JEDDAH

‑

SAUDI ARABIA

On another note, I will leave it to @Abdullah Almadhi <mailto:Abdullah.Almadhi@chalhoub.com>  to share the contract with the venue 'Diriyah’ for consistency.

 

Looking forward to hearing back.

 

Many thanks.

 

Regards,

 

AYAH YAMANI

​​​​

DIRECTOR ‑ COUNTRY MANAGEMENT



CHALHOUB GROUP ARABIA LIMITED COMPANY LLC

JEDDAH

‑

SAUDI ARABIA
